title: Chogath buffs on pbe.. why?
body: The buff gives him 2 stacks for his ult on champion kills and if at full stacks it heals him. Does he really need these buffs? Maybe it isn't that big of a buff but he was strong already imo and I think many ppl agreed with me.

replies.body:
They are more usability buffs than anything. His ult (prior to PBE) had an awkward use case where:

* Have less than 6 stacks? You save it for minions/monsters due to the reduced CD for doing so. That way, you can get stacks faster. (Ulting an enemy champion is generally something you avoid if possible.)
* Have 6 stacks? You save it for baron/dragon or an enemy champion.

The PBE change makes it so killing an enemy will give you double stacks (to make up for not getting reduced CD) and also give a little incentive to use your ult on creatures for sustain.

They are more like consistency changes or QOL buffs rather than actually buffs.

The extra stack on champion kill will only encourage Cho'gath to use his ultimate on champions rather than on minions every 30 seconds.
Realistically, his stack rate doesn't increase, since the CD on feast is reduced by 50% when he ults a minion or monster.

So rather than stacking feast for 3 minutes after hitting level 6 and then spamming the ultimate on the closest champion every time it is off CD, Riot is allowing Cho'gath to consider saving the ultimate for a champion kill instead.

As well, Cho'gath's ultimate already heals him IF he does not have 6 stacks. Giving him the heal even when he has max feast stacks does seem like a buff, but currently Cho'gath would just try to  ult the carry at the beginning of a team fight to lay down some burst damage. With this change, Cho'gath might actually save his ultimate for a more opportune moment rather than just using it ASAP as mentioned earlier.
